Patent Information.Abstract: Antifungal and antibacterial peptides, polypeptides and proteins as antifungal additives for paint and other coatings are disclosed, along with antifungal compositions, and coated surfaces with antifungal properties. Methods of using the coatings for treating and/or inhibiting growth of mold, mildew and other fungi and bacteria on objects such as building materials that are susceptible to such infestation are also disclosed.

Antifungal and antibacterial peptides, polypeptides and proteins as antifungal additives for paint and other coatings are disclosed, along with antifungal compositions, and coated surfaces with antifungal properties. Methods of using the coatings for treating and/or inhibiting growth of mold, mildew and other fungi and bacteria on objects such as building materials that are susceptible to such infestation are also disclosed.

Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Opistoporin-2 (OP2; Non-disulfide-bridged peptide 3.6, NDBP-3.6; Arthropods, animals)
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the antimicrobial peptide scorpion family
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Swiss_Prot Entry P83314]strong antibacterial activity against Gram-negative bacteria but is less active against Gram-positive bacteria. Also has antifungal activity.
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Swiss_Prot Entry P83314]Weak hemolytic activity against human erythrocytes
Sequence Information.Function: At high concentrations, acts as pore former in cellular membranes and causes the leakage of the cells. At submicromolar concentrations, degranulates granulocytes and has weak hemolytic activity against human red blood cells. Also strongly inhibits the production of superoxide anions. Has a strong antibacterial activity against Gram-negative bacteria but is less active against Gram-positive bacteria. Also has antifungal activity. (By similarity)

Literature.Title: Antibacterial and antifungal properties of alpha-helical, cationic peptides in the venom of scorpions from southern Africa.
Literature.Author: Moerman L, Bosteels S, Noppe W, Willems J, Clynen E, Schoofs L, Thevissen K, Tytgat J, Van Eldere J, Van Der Walt J, Verdonck F.
